text: {"answer": "B", "reasoning": "This continuation best extends an ECHR argument excerpt that is assessing the admissibility of a complaint. Option B follows the standard ECHR admissibility analysis pattern: first determining the complaint is not manifestly ill-founded under Article 35 ยง 3(a), then confirming no other inadmissibility grounds exist, and concluding with a declaration of admissibility. This is the typical formulation used when the Court proceeds to examine a complaint on the merits. Options A and D are rejection/inadmissibility formulations, and Option C presupposes a prior Article 8 violation finding and declines separate examination, which is a different procedural context."}
